text:
Has anyone got experience working with NASA’s AppEEARS API? I’m having some trouble getting off the ground — it’s complaining about my JSON formatting for some reason…

(I’m trying to get hold of global elevation data, and this source seems reasonable. If this isn’t the best place to go for this kind of data though, I would be very happy to be directed elsewhere!)

text: I've only got some experience in talking to the GEDI subsetter, which is not the same, but "close by". No problems with JSON though, although debugging the HTTP thing is a bit hard in Julia (for me that is), so I often try the requests manually/in browser.

elements.text: I've only got some experience in talking to the GEDI subsetter, which is not the same, but "close by". No problems with JSON though, although debugging the HTTP thing is a bit hard in Julia (for me that is), so I often try the requests manually/in browser.

text:
```# <https://lpdaacsvc.cr.usgs.gov/services/gedifinder?product=GEDI02_A&version=001&bbox=[28.0,-83,24.0,-79]>
url = "<https://lpdaacsvc.cr.usgs.gov/services/gedifinder>?"
q = Dict(
        "bbox" => "[$(bbox.max_y),$(bbox.min_x),$(bbox.min_y),$(bbox.max_x)]",
        "version" => version,
        "product" => product
        )
r = HTTP.get(url, query=q, verbose=2)```

text: Not sure if it helps, but SRTM is one of the global elevation datasets that people frequently use: <https://www2.jpl.nasa.gov/srtm/>
